title: Birth rate in Italy 2018 , by region
summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Birth rate per thousand inhabitants for 20 number of Months.
The Birth rate per thousand inhabitants is highest at Month Trentino-South Tyrol and lowest at Month Sardinia.
The minimum Month Sardinia has got 1.58 times less Birth rate per thousand inhabitants than the maximum Month Trentino-South Tyrol.
min_summary: This bar chart has 20 columns on the x axis representing Month, and Birth rate per thousand inhabitants in each Month on the y axis.
The Birth rate per thousand inhabitants is appeared to be the highest at Month Trentino-South Tyrol and lowest at Month Sardinia.
mid_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Birth rate per thousand inhabitants for 20 number of Months.
The Birth rate per thousand inhabitants is highest at Month Trentino-South Tyrol and lowest at Month Sardinia.
The minimum Month Sardinia has got 1.58 times less Birth rate per thousand inhabitants than the maximum Month Trentino-South Tyrol.
max_summary: This bar chart has 20 columns on the x axis representing Month, and Birth rate per thousand inhabitants in each Month on the y axis.
The Birth rate per thousand inhabitants is highest at Month Trentino-South Tyrol and lowest at Month Sardinia.
Second maximum Birth rate per thousand inhabitants is found at Month Campania.
The maximum Month Trentino-South Tyrol has got 1.58 times higher Birth rate per thousand inhabitants than the minimum Month Sardinia.
Birth rate per thousand inhabitants at Month Trentino-South Tyrol is 9.0 , second place is Campania at 8.3, and thirdly is Sicily at 8.1.
Over the past 20 Months, the Birth rate per thousand inhabitants has reduced.
Month Lazio, Apulia, Aosta Valley, and Veneto share the same value 7.2.
The lowest value 5.7 at Sardinia is almost 1.28 times smaller than the average value 7.05.
The Birth rate per thousand inhabitants is 141.0 if we add up values of all Months.
